Models¶

models.py¶

This contains all the db tables in the form of class to create a table instance we can just call this class’s object and add remove or update the database.

class jobHunt.models.Job(*args, **kwargs)¶

class Job: Stores the jobs data crapped from job portals. :param name: job_title - used to identify the job category locally :param type: string :param name: tag - job tags scrapped from web :param type: string :param name: company - name of company :param type: string :param name: location - location scrapped from web :param type: string :param name: salary - salary scrapped from web :param type: string :param name: link - link to apply for job :param type: string :param name: experience - experience if any scrapped from web :param type: string :param name: content - content in the job card scrapped from web :param type: string :param name: date - date on which we added the job to the database :param type: object of date

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class jobHunt.models.Job_preference(*args, **kwargs)¶

class Job_preference: Strores the mapping of job preference of user with user mail id. :param name: email - foreign key to email in Seeker table. :param type: string :param name: job_title - job preference of the user :param type: string

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
email¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class jobHunt.models.Seeker(*args, **kwargs)¶

class Seeker: Stores infromation about the registered user and their location preference. :param name: email - Email id of the user is the primary key for Seeker table :param type: string :param name: location1 - first location preference :param type: string :param name: location2 - second location prefernce :param type: string :param name: location3 - third location preference :param type: string

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
email¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

job_preference_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.
